result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary Santiago-Diaz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary Santiago-Diaz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Santiago-Diaz

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $865.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/29/2022 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 03/01/2024. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    CHRIS HAMMOND  $865.00
of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.
09/14/22 bond applied to case an done error,  on 05//10/22  Court orders  bail to be returned to person who posted. A full refund processed,

Defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz in court.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Gary Santiago-Diaz.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
BRANCH 41, JUDGE SKWIERAWSKI for BRANCH 29, JUDGE KIEFER.

AS TO COUNT 1:  On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Co. Ord. 63.01 to which defendant pled guilty. Court found defendant guilty and ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.000 inclusive of all costs and surcharges by 11/14/2022 or civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed.
Case set for a jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution. Due to court calendar congestion, case is spun to Branch 41. Parties notified.

Defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond appeared by video for Gary Santiago-Diaz.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/14/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 1:30 pm. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Final pre-trial set for 8/30/22 at 1:30 pm and jury trial is set for 9/14/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz in court with attorney Christopher S. Hammond.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
The 4/8/22 Cash Bond Posted entry for $1,000.00 does not belong to this case.  sb
signed and filed.

Defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pre-trial conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Christopher Hammond to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders  bail to be returned to person who posted.   
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gary Santiago-Diaz in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  SAW  and K.S ( 08/25/12)
Received and Filed.
Initial appearance on May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
